title: 106_s3
content: The Act titled "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates. No amendment made by section 2 will be considered a change in tax rate for tax purposes. The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. For taxable income levels ranging from $43,050 to $283,150, the tax rates range from 13.5% to 32.4% with specific amounts added based on income brackets. For heads of households, the tax rates range from 13.5% to 35.64% for taxable income levels between $43,050 and over $283,150, with specific amounts added based on income brackets. For heads of households, the tax rates range from 13.5% to 35.64% for taxable income levels between $43,050 and over $283,150, with specific amounts added based on income brackets. The tax rates vary based on income levels, with percentages and specific amounts added for different income brackets. For unmarried individuals (other than surviving spouses and heads of households), tax rates range from 32.4% to 35.64% for taxable income levels over $144,400 and over $283,150 respectively. Tax rates for unmarried individuals (excluding surviving spouses and heads of households) range from 32.4% to 35.64% for taxable income levels over $144,400 and $283,150, respectively. For unmarried individuals, tax rates range from 13.5% to 32.4% based on taxable income levels. For married individuals filing separate returns, tax rates range from 32.4% to 35.64% based on taxable income levels. Tax rates for taxable income levels vary for married individuals filing separate returns. For taxable income not over $21,525, the tax is 13.5% of taxable income. For income over $21,525 but not over $52,025, the tax is $2,905.87 plus 25.2% of the excess over $21,525. For income over $52,025 but not over $79,275, the tax is $10,591.87 plus 27.9% of the excess over $52,025. For income over $79,275 but not over $141,575, the tax is $18,194.62 plus 32.4% of the excess over $79,275. Tax rates for estates and trusts vary based on taxable income levels. For income over $141,575, the tax is $38,379.82 plus 35.64% of the excess over $141,575. Tax rates for estates and trusts vary based on taxable income levels. If taxable income is not over $1,750, the tax is 13.5% of taxable income. For income over $1,750 but not over $4,050, the tax is $236.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $1,750. For income over $4,050 but not over $6,200, the tax is $815.85 plus 27.9% of the excess over $4,050. For income over $6,200 but not over $8,450, the tax is $1,415.70 plus 32.4% of the excess over $6,200. If income is over $8,450, a different tax rate applies. Tax rates for estates and trusts vary based on taxable income levels. For income over $8,450, the tax is $2,144.70 plus 35.64% of the excess over $8,450. Inflation adjustment conforming amendments have been made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates from 1992 to 1998 in various sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates in various sections, including Section 25A(h), Section 32(j)(1)(B), Section 41(e)(5)(C), Section 59(j)(2)(B), Section 63(c)(4)(B), Section 68(b)(2)(B), Section 135(b)(2)(B)(ii), Section 151(d)(4), Section 220(g)(2), Section 221(g)(1)(B), Section 512(d)(2)(B), Section 513(h)(2)(C)(ii), Section 685(c)(3)(B), Section 877(a)(2), and Section 911(b)(2)(D)(ii)(II). The following sections are amended in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986: Section 2032A(a)(3)(B), Section 2503(b)(2)(B), Section 2631(c)(1)(B), Section 4001(e)(1)(B), Section 4261(e)(4)(A)(ii), Section 6039F(d), Section 6323(i)(4)(B), Section 6601(j)(3)(B), and Section 7430(c)(1). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended in various sections including Section 4001(e)(1)(B), Section 4261(e)(4)(A)(ii), Section 6039F(d), Section 6323(i)(4)(B), Section 6601(j)(3)(B), and Section 7430(c)(1). Additionally, amendments are made to Section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) and Section 132(f)(6) by changing the years referenced in the provisions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended in various sections, including changes to percentages and the removal of a paragraph. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by changing percentages in several sections and removing a paragraph. Specifically, the amendments include reducing the percentage from 28% to 25.2% in certain paragraphs, changing the percentage from 39.6% to 35.64% in sections 531 and 541, and adjusting the percentages in section 3402(p)(1)(B) from 7%, 15%, 28%, or 31% to 7%, 13.5%, 25.2%, or 27.9%. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change percentages in various sections. For example, the percentage in section 541 is reduced from 39.6% to 35.64%, and in section 3402(p)(1)(B) from 7%, 15%, 28%, or 31% to 7%, 13.5%, 25.2%, or 27.9%. Other sections also see adjustments in percentages. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change percentages in various sections, such as reducing the percentage in section 541 from 39.6% to 35.64%. Sections like 3402(p)(1)(B) are also amended to change percentages from 7%, 15%, 28%, or 31% to 7%, 13.5%, 25.2%, or 27.9%. Effective dates for these changes are specified.
